Abstract: This study explores the mechanisms of slip localization in metallic materials, integrating advanced experimental and numerical techniques to elucidate the underlying crystallographic processes. By combining high-resolution electron microscopy with finite element modeling, we provide new insights into the evolution of dislocation structures and their impact on the mechanical properties of materials. The findings highlight the critical role of slip band formation and interaction in governing plastic deformation, offering a comprehensive framework for predicting and controlling material behavior under various loading conditions.
